section.title: Example
section.description: The following script populates an array with the names of the tables in the current database. The A5.TABLE_ENUM() method returns a CR-LF delimited list of all of the tables in a database when called with no argument.

This script creates and populates an array with 5 elements. The <<%list% ... %list% construct is used to indicate to Xbasic that you are entering character data that spans more than one physical line.
section.example: dim colors[5] as C colors.initialize(<<%list% blue red green yellow pink %list%)

section.description: The following script populates an array with the first and last names of people in Massachusetts from the Customer table.
section.example: dim names[100] as C list = table.external_record_content_GET("customer", "alltrim(firstname) + ' ' + lastname", "lastname", "state = 'ma'") names.initialize(list)
